PERSONAL PROFILE  
 
A confident,  innovative  and proactive  process engineer with a background in chemical engineering. S trong 
knowledge of Environmental  Science and Process  Safety, alongside  other core  chemical engineering 
principals. Thrive s working in a challenging environment with a resilient attitude to complete tasks. Possess 
excellent written and verbal communication skills developed at university and  various profession al work 
placements, through written reports and presentations. An inquisitive nature encourages  ambition, used 
alongside creative  ability, to learn  quickly in any given environment.

SAGHIR  23 Croston  Street,  Bolton,  BL3 4AP,  UK

Sarish.Saghir@outlook.com 
PERSONAL PROFILE  
 
A confident,  innovative  and proactive  process engineer with a background in chemical engineering. S trong 
knowledge of Environmental  Science and Process  Safety, alongside  other core  chemical engineering 
principals. Thrive s working in a challenging environment with a resilient attitude to complete tasks. Possess 
excellent written and verbal communication skills developed at university and  various profession al work 
placements, through written reports and presentations. An inquisitive nature encourages  ambition, used 
alongside creative  ability, to learn  quickly in any given environment.  
 
EDUCATION  
BEng  Chemical  Engineering | University of  Chester | 2017 – 2020 
Grade  Achieved  – First Class  Honours  
• Modules included: Process System Engineering, Chemical Reactors and Catalysis, 
Fluid  Mechanics, Renewable Energy,  Sustainability and Low Carbon  Technologies,  
Thermodynamics  
• Design Project: Design of a plant producing 300MW e of electricity from wood with  
carbon  capture. Design  task involved  conducting hazard  identification  and HAZOP.  
 
A-levels | Bradford Girls Grammar  School | 2014 – 2016 
• Mathematics,  Biology  and Chemistry,  Grades  A-B 
 
GCSE  | Dixons Allerton Academy | 2009 – 2016 
• 14 GCSE,  Grades  A*- B Including Mathematics and  English.  
 
PROFESSIONAL WORK  EXPERIENCE  
Process Engineer  | Novelis  Europe | June 2020 – Present  
• Process improvement leading to a significant reduction in process downtime and EHS risks  
including:  
o Rotex screen equipment improvement and procedure review as a long- term solution  
o Decoater water  spray system upgrade 
• Utilising data analysis tools e.g. Pareto, for various uses including root cause analysis and 
process improvements  
• Development of KPIs to measure reliability performance of the process  
• WCM project involvement across the site 
• Defined and implemented standards for process operators to manage and maintain assets 
whilst optimising production output 
• Meeting facilitation  
• PI Process Book and Vision:  
 Development of event frames to monitor process deviations  
 Data analysis for RCA investigations  
• Contractor management 
• Daily inter -departmental meetings to support completing improvement and preventative 
actions  
Junior Process Engineer | Croda  Europe | June 2019 – August 2019 

• Compiled  and analysed  data  to carry out risk assessments  on safety  critical pressure 
relief  systems.  
• Updated  site and plant  P&ID’s using Auto  CAD,  as many  drawings were as old as 1995.  
• Relabelled  and tagged  major  pipelines,  utility streams  and processing systems on plant.  
• Assisted  a senior  process engineer  in conducting an open  ends  risk assessment.  
• Took part in various  observations  involving  analysing  and resolving  issues  causing  
process failure  leading  to poor  quality  products.  
• Shadowed  and helped  other  process engineers  during the design,  optimisation  and 
installation  of new systems.  
• Helped  senior  engineers  assure  product and process quality using  various  design  testing 
method.  
 
Junior Process Engineer  | Johnson Matthey | June 2018  – October 2018 
• Scoped the replacement of an inefficient pneumatic conveying device to develop a  
solution of a problem which was not addressed for a long period of time. Some of the 
tasks  involved  with this  project included:  
 Pressure  drop,  fluid  velocity and particle  entrainment calculations.  
 Drafting a scope  document detailing  proposed  modifications.  
 Communicating  to a number  of different suppliers.  
• Reconciled  data on material and product quality from graphs.  
• Monitored plant processes  using distribution control systems, Delta V and Pi Process.  
• Attended various Environmental Health and Safety meetings.  
• Participated in conducting trials and industrial tests on a new product in its developmental 
stage.  
 
SKILLS  
• Developed  an d now  proficient in the use of important  engineering softwares  such  as 
AUTOCAD,  MATLAB

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
